'''Mike Singleton''' (born [[1951]]) was the developer of the video games ''[[Shadowfax (video game)|Shadowfax]]''<ref>{{webcite|author=Fredrik Ekman|articleurl=http://www.lysator.liu.se/tolkien-games/entry/shadowfax.html|articlename=Shadowfax|dated=|website=Games|accessed=14 august 2011}}</ref><ref name="World of Spectrum">{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.worldofspectrum.org/infoseekpub.cgi?regexp=^Mike+Singleton$|articlename=Mike Singleton|dated=|website=[[wikipedia:World of Spectrum|World of Spectrum]]|accessed=29 december 2014}}</ref> and ''[[War in Middle Earth]]''.<ref name="World of Spectrum"/><ref>{{webcite|author=Fredrik Ekman|articleurl=http://www.lysator.liu.se/tolkien-games/entry/wime.html|articlename=War in Middle-Earth|dated=|website=Games|accessed=4 december 2014}}</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=José M. Fernández|articleurl=http://www.meristation.com/v3/des_articulo.php?pic=CON&id=2254&idj=&idp=&tipo=art&c=1&pos=5|articlename=El Anillo interactivo|dated=17 january 2012|website=[http://www.meristation.com Meristation]|accessed=29 december 2014}}</ref> Mike Singleton was originally an English teacher<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.mobygames.com/developer/sheet/view/developerId,17924/|articlename=Mike Singleton|dated=|website=[http://www.mobygames/com Moby Games]|accessed=15 august 2010}}</ref> but decided to become a game designer.<ref>{{webcite|author=Roger Kean|articleurl=http://www.crashonline.org.uk/14/singletn.htm|articlename=I BET TOLKIEN DID THE SAME|dated=|website=[http://www.crashonline.org.uk/ Crash Online]|accessed=29 december 2014}}</ref> He first worked for [[Postern]], but later switched to [[Melbourne House]].
